properties.Name: Brule River Boreal Forest
properties.description:
Brule River Boreal Forest

Brule River State Forest is a boreal forest in various stages of recovery that borders the Brule River. Rare animals in the area include the bald eagle. Area is best seen by canoe

Link to the description and map of Brule River Boreal Forest State Natural Area from the Wisconsin DNR.
www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: Brule River Boreal Forest
properties.Paragraph1_Text: Brule River State Forest is a boreal forest in various stages of recovery that borders the Brule River. Rare animals in the area include the bald eagle.  Area is best seen by canoe

properties.Name: Dwight's Point and Pokegama Wetlands
properties.description:
Dwight's Point and Pokegama Wetlands

Within the Superior Municipal Forest, Dwight's Point and Pokegama Wetlands features boreal forest, emergent marsh, and wet clay flats. Accessible by water, or various hiking, biking, skiing, and snowmobile trails.

Link to the description and map of Dwight's Point and Pokegama Wetlands State Natural Area from the Wisconsin DNR.
www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: Dwight's Point and Pokegama Wetlands
properties.Paragraph1_Text: Within the Superior Municipal Forest, Dwight's Point and Pokegama Wetlands features boreal forest, emergent marsh, and wet clay flats. Accessible by water, or various hiking, biking, skiing, and snowmobile trails.

properties.Name: Bear Beach
properties.description:
Bear Beach

Bear Beach features several extensive stretches of undeveloped beach along the Lake Superior shore, west of the Brule River mouth. Best seen by canoe.

Link to the description and map of Bear Beach State Natural Area from the Wisconsin DNR.
www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: Bear Beach
properties.Paragraph1_Text: Bear Beach features several extensive stretches of undeveloped beach along the Lake Superior shore, west of the Brule River mouth.  Best seen by canoe.

properties.Name: Pokegama Carnegie Wetlands
properties.description:
Pokegama Carnegie Wetlands

Pokegama Carnegie Wetlands features an extensive mosaic of wetland vegetation containing many rare plant species. It is situated on level clay flats between the Pokegama and Little Pokegama Rivers.

Link to the description and map of Pokegama Carnegie Wetlands State Natural Area from the Wisconsin DNR.
www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: Pokegama Carnegie Wetlands
properties.Paragraph1_Text: Pokegama Carnegie Wetlands features an extensive mosaic of wetland vegetation containing many rare plant species. It is situated on level clay flats between the Pokegama and Little Pokegama Rivers.

properties.Name: Bark Bay Slough
properties.description:
Bark Bay Slough

Bark Bay Slough consists of a coastal barrier spit, lagoon, springs, and wetlands occupying an embayment between two rocky headlands along Lake Superior. Best explored by canoe.

Link to the description and map of Bark Bay Slough State Natural Area from the Wisconsin DNR.
www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: Bark Bay Slough
properties.Paragraph1_Text: Bark Bay Slough consists of a coastal barrier spit, lagoon, springs, and wetlands occupying an embayment between two rocky headlands along Lake Superior. Best explored by canoe.

properties.Name: Port Wing Boreal Forest
properties.description:
Port Wing Boreal Forest

Port Wing Boreal Forest encompasses two areas of forest on sand spits inland from the present Lake Superior shoreline. It includes a 20-acre beach and dune complex along the shoreline.

Link to the description and map of Port Wing Boreal Forest State Natural Area from the Wisconsin DNR.
www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: Port Wing Boreal Forest
properties.Paragraph1_Text: Port Wing Boreal Forest encompasses two areas of forest on sand spits inland from the present Lake Superior shoreline. It includes a 20-acre beach and dune complex along the shoreline.

properties.Name: Lost Creek Bog
properties.description:
Lost Creek Bog

Lost Creek Bog features a Lake Superior estuarine system at the drowned mouths of three small creeks (Lost Creek 1, 2, and 3) where they empty into Siskiwit Bay. Migratory waterfowl and other water birds make extensive use of the site.

Link to the description and map of Lost Creek Bog State Natural Area from the Wisconsin DNR.
www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: Lost Creek Bog
properties.Paragraph1_Text: Lost Creek Bog features a Lake Superior estuarine system at the drowned mouths of three small creeks (Lost Creek 1, 2, and 3) where they empty into Siskiwit Bay. Migratory waterfowl and other water birds make extensive use of the site.

properties.Name: Houghton Falls
properties.description:
Houghton Falls

Houghton Falls protects a picturesque pre-Cambrian sandstone gorge along the Lake Superior shore. The dramatic sandstone cliffs extend into the clear waters of Lake Superior, affording views of the Apostle Islands. Houghton Falls is owned by the Town of Bayview and was designated a State Natural Area in 2010.

Link to the description and map of Houghton Falls State Natural Area from the Wisconsin DNR.
www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: Houghton Falls
properties.Paragraph1_Text: Houghton Falls protects a picturesque pre-Cambrian sandstone gorge along the Lake Superior shore. The dramatic sandstone cliffs extend into the clear waters of Lake Superior, affording views of the Apostle Islands. Houghton Falls is owned by the Town of Bayview and was designated a State Natural Area in 2010.

properties.Name: Big Bay Sand Spit and Bog
properties.description:
Big Bay Sand Spit and Bog

Big Bay Sand Spit and Bog is located on an island in Lake Superior and features a long, curving bay mouth bar behind which lies a lagoon. An extensive "cord walk" allows visitors to traverse the bay mouth bar without disturbing the sensitive vegetation.

Link to the description and map of Big Bay Sand Spit and Bog State Natural Area from the Wisconsin DNR.
www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: Big Bay Sand Spit and Bog
properties.Paragraph1_Text: Big Bay Sand Spit and Bog is located on an island in Lake Superior and features a long, curving bay mouth bar behind which lies a lagoon.  An extensive "cord walk" allows visitors to traverse the bay mouth bar without disturbing the sensitive vegetation.

properties.Name: Apostle Islands Maritime Forest
properties.description:
Apostle Islands Maritime Forest

Apostle Islands Maritime Forests consists of portions of five islands (Sand Island, Raspberry Island, Outer Island, Bear Island, and Devils Island) within the 21-island Apostle Islands archipelago. Islands accessible only by water.

Link to the description of Apostle Islands Maritime Forest State Natural Area from the Wisconsin DNR.
www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: Apostle Islands Maritime Forest
properties.Paragraph1_Text: Apostle Islands Maritime Forests consists of portions of five islands (Sand Island, Raspberry Island, Outer Island, Bear Island, and Devils Island) within the 21-island Apostle Islands archipelago.  Islands accessible only by water.

properties.Name: Apostle Islands Maritime Cliffs
properties.description:
Apostle Islands Maritime Cliffs

Two Lake Superior islands, Otter and Devils, within the Apostle Islands archipelago and an area of mainland, Mawikwe Bay, in Bayfield County all contain units of this State Natural Area. These unique sites feature exposed sandstone cliffs, sea caves, vaulted chambers, arches, and pillars.

Link to the description and map of Apostle Islands Maritime Cliffs State Natural Area from the Wisconsin DNR.
www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: Apostle Islands Maritime Cliffs
properties.Paragraph1_Text: Two Lake Superior islands, Otter and Devils, within the Apostle Islands archipelago and an area of mainland, Mawikwe Bay, in Bayfield County all contain units of this State Natural Area. These unique sites feature exposed sandstone cliffs, sea caves, vaulted chambers, arches, and pillars.

properties.Name: Apostle Islands Sandscapes
properties.description:
Apostle Islands Sandscapes

The Apostle Islands Sandscapes State Natural Area was established in 1992 to recognize and protect a variety of unique sand-based landforms, including dunes, beaches, sand spits, cuspate forelands, and tombolos. It is located within the Apostle Islands National Lakeshore on Raspberry, Rocky, Stockton and Outer Islands.

Link to the description and map of Apostle Islands Sandscapes State Natural Area from the Wisconsin DNR.
www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: Apostle Islands Sandscapes
properties.Paragraph1_Text: The Apostle Islands Sandscapes State Natural Area was established in 1992 to recognize and protect a variety of unique sand-based landforms, including dunes, beaches, sand spits, cuspate forelands, and tombolos.  It is located within the Apostle Islands National Lakeshore on Raspberry, Rocky, Stockton and Outer Islands.

properties.Name: Apostle Islands Yew Forest
properties.description:
Apostle Islands Yew Forest

The Apostle Islands Yew Forest SNA is comprised of four islands that reflect complex disturbance histories ranging from pristine old-growth forest without a history of deer browse, to forests subjected to logging, fires, and extensive deer browse. The diversity of disturbance gradients and subsequent recovery of vegetation, including Canada Yew, will provide important scientific data on the ecology of these four unique islands. Apostle Islands Yew Forest is owned by the US Park Service and was designated a State Natural Area in 2010.

Link to the description and map of Apostle Islands Yew Forest State Natural Area from the Wisconsin DNR.
www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: Apostle Islands Yew Forest
properties.Paragraph1_Text: The Apostle Islands Yew Forest SNA is comprised of four islands that reflect complex disturbance histories ranging from pristine old-growth forest without a history of deer browse, to forests subjected to logging, fires, and extensive deer browse. The diversity of disturbance gradients and subsequent recovery of vegetation, including Canada Yew, will provide important scientific data on the ecology of these four unique islands. Apostle Islands Yew Forest is owned by the US Park Service and was designated a State Natural Area in 2010.

properties.Name: Apostle Islands Critical Species
properties.description:
Apostle Islands Critical Species

This natural area in Lake Superior consists of units on Eagle and Gull Islands within the Apostle Islands archipelago. It was designated to recognize critical nesting areas for gulls and colonial water birds.

Link to the description of Apostle Islands Critical Species State Natural Area from the Wisconsin DNR.
www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: Apostle Islands Critical Species
properties.Paragraph1_Text: This natural area in Lake Superior consists of units on Eagle and Gull Islands within the Apostle Islands archipelago. It was designated to recognize critical nesting areas for gulls and colonial water birds.

properties.Name: Seagull Bar
properties.description:
Seagull Bar

Seagull Bar is a sand spit and marsh on the margin of Green Bay off the City of Marinette. It is an important area for migratory birds. Seagull Bar was designated a State Natural Area in 1962.

Link to the description and map of Seagull Bar State Natural Area from the Wisconsin DNR.
www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: Seagull Bar
properties.Paragraph1_Text: Seagull Bar is a sand spit and marsh on the margin of Green Bay off the City of Marinette. It is an important area for migratory birds.  Seagull Bar was designated a State Natural Area in 1962.

properties.Name: Bloch Oxbow and Pines
properties.description:
Bloch Oxbow and Pines

The Bloch Oxbow and Pines 614-acre site borders the Peshtigo River. The site serves as a reserve for northern forest, floodplain forest, as an aquatic reserve, and as an ecological reference area.

Link to the description and map of Bloch Oxbow and Pines State Natural Area from the Wisconsin DNR.
www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: Bloch Oxbow and Pines
properties.Paragraph1_Text: The Bloch Oxbow and Pines 614-acre site borders the Peshtigo River.  The site serves as a reserve for northern forest, floodplain forest, as an aquatic reserve, and as an ecological reference area.

properties.Name: Peshtigo Harbor Lacustrine Forest
properties.description:
Peshtigo Harbor Lacustrine Forest

Peshtigo Harbor Lacustrine Forest represents one of the least disturbed and best remaining examples of the hardwood swamps along the west shore of Green Bay. It is located within Green Bay West Shores Wildlife Area.

Link to the description and map of Peshtigo Harbor Lacustrine Forest State Natural Area from the Wisconsin DNR.
www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: Peshtigo Harbor Lacustrine Forest
properties.Paragraph1_Text: Peshtigo Harbor Lacustrine Forest represents one of the least disturbed and best remaining examples of the hardwood swamps along the west shore of Green Bay. It is located within Green Bay West Shores Wildlife Area.

properties.Name: Peshtigo River Delta Marshes
properties.description:
Peshtigo River Delta Marshes

Peshtigo River Delta Marshes is an extensive meadow and marsh complex. The site borders the mouth of the Peshtigo River along the west shore of Green Bay.

Link to the description and map of Peshtigo River Delta Marshes State Natural Area from the Wisconsin DNR.
www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: Peshtigo River Delta Marshes
properties.Paragraph1_Text: Peshtigo River Delta Marshes is an extensive meadow and marsh complex.  The site borders the mouth of the Peshtigo River along the west shore of Green Bay.

properties.Name: Charles Pond
properties.description:
Charles Pond

Charles Pond was designated a State Natural Area in 1965. At the time it was a bay mouth bar lake with a narrow outlet to Green Bay, but high water levels during the 1980's destroyed all of the marshland and part of the forest.

Link to the description and map of Charles Pond State Natural Area from the Wisconsin DNR.
www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: Charles Pond
properties.Paragraph1_Text: Charles Pond was designated a State Natural Area in 1965. At the time it was a bay mouth bar lake with a narrow outlet to Green Bay, but high water levels during the 1980's  destroyed all of the marshland and part of the forest.

properties.Name: Baileys Harbor Boreal Forest and Wetlands
properties.description:
Baileys Harbor Boreal Forest and Wetlands

Baileys Harbor Boreal Forest and Wetlands contains a unique and diverse landscape, influenced by the local climate along the northeastern coast of the Door Peninsula (cooler springs and summers, and warmer falls and winters). The 463-acre site was designated a State Natural Area in 1995.

Link to the description and map of Baileys Harbor Boreal Forest and Wetlands State Natural Area from the Wisconsin DNR.
www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: Baileys Harbor Boreal Forest and Wetlands
properties.Paragraph1_Text: Baileys Harbor Boreal Forest and Wetlands contains a unique and diverse landscape, influenced by the local climate along the northeastern coast of the Door Peninsula (cooler springs and summers, and warmer falls and winters).  The 463-acre site was designated a State Natural Area in 1995.

properties.Name: Bayshore Blufflands
properties.description:
Bayshore Blufflands

Bayshore Blufflands is a complex site with a diversity of plant communities. Trails provide access into and through the site. It was designated a State Natural Area in 2002.

Link to the description and map of Bayshore Blufflands State Natural Area from the Wisconsin DNR.
www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: Bayshore Blufflands
properties.Paragraph1_Text: Bayshore Blufflands is a complex site with a diversity of plant communities.  Trails provide access into and through the site.  It was designated a State Natural Area in 2002.

properties.Name: Big and Little Marsh
properties.description:
Big and Little Marsh

Located on Washington Island, off the tip of the Door County peninsula, the site harbors numerous rare species. Included within the natural area is 200 feet of the Lake Michigan shoreline.

Link to the description and map of Big and Little Marsh State Natural Area from the Wisconsin DNR.
www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: Big and Little Marsh
properties.Paragraph1_Text: Located on Washington Island, off the tip of the Door County peninsula, the site harbors numerous rare species. Included within the natural area is 200 feet of the Lake Michigan shoreline.

properties.Name: Cave Point-Clay Banks (Shivering Sands Unit)
properties.description:
Cave Point-Clay Banks (Shivering Sands Unit)

Cave Point-Clay Banks is an extensive complex of coastal wetlands that supports many unique plants and animals. Kellner Fen, Shivering Sands, and Sturgeon Bay comprise the State Natural Area along the shore of Lake Michigan.

Link to the description of Cave Point-Clay Banks State Natural Area from the Wisconsin DNR.
www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: Cave Point-Clay Banks
properties.Paragraph1_Text: Cave Point-Clay Banks is an extensive complex of coastal wetlands that supports many unique plants and animals.  Kellner Fen, Shivering Sands, and Sturgeon Bay comprise the State Natural Area along the shore of Lake Michigan.

properties.Name: Cave Point-Clay Banks (Sturgeon Bay Canal Unit)
properties.description:
Cave Point-Clay Banks (Sturgeon Bay Canal Unit)

Cave Point-Clay Banks is an extensive complex of coastal wetlands that supports many unique plants and animals. Kellner Fen, Shivering Sands, and Sturgeon Bay comprise the State Natural Area along the shore of Lake Michigan.

Link to the description and map of Cave Point-Clay Banks State Natural Area from the Wisconsin DNR.
www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: Cave Point-Clay Banks
properties.Paragraph1_Text: Cave Point-Clay Banks is an extensive complex of coastal wetlands that supports many unique plants and animals.  Kellner Fen, Shivering Sands, and Sturgeon Bay comprise the State Natural Area along the shore of Lake Michigan.

properties.Name: Coffey Swamp
properties.description:
Coffey Swamp

Coffey Swamp occupies a former embayment of Lake Michigan along the northern coast of Washington Island. It was designated a State Natural Area in 1994.

Link to the description and map of Coffey Swamp State Natural Area from the Wisconsin DNR.
www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: Coffey Swamp
properties.Paragraph1_Text: Coffey Swamp occupies a former embayment of Lake Michigan along the northern coast of Washington Island. It was designated a State Natural Area in 1994.

properties.Name: Detroit Harbor
properties.description:
Detroit Harbor

Detroit Harbor State Natural Area features a diverse complex of wetlands that support numerous rare species. The natural area also includes Richter Bayou, which is a significant smallmouth bass nursery. The site was designated a State Natural Area in 2005.

Link to the description and map of Detroit Harbor State Natural Area from the Wisconsin DNR.
www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: Detroit Harbor
properties.Paragraph1_Text: Detroit Harbor State Natural Area features a diverse complex of wetlands that support numerous rare species. The natural area also includes Richter Bayou, which is a significant smallmouth bass nursery. The site was designated a State Natural Area in 2005.

properties.Name: Ellison Bluff
properties.description:
Ellison Bluff

Ellison Bluff features a densely wooded two-tiered rock terrace. One cedar was determined to be 250 years old. View the site from an observation deck or on the hiking trails.

Link to the description and map of Ellison Bluff State Natural Area from the Wisconsin DNR.
www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: Ellison Bluff
properties.Paragraph1_Text: Ellison Bluff features a densely wooded two-tiered rock terrace. One cedar was determined to be 250 years old.  View the site from an observation deck or on the hiking trails.

properties.Name: Europe Bay Woods
properties.description:
Europe Bay Woods

Europe Bay Woods is located on an undeveloped isthmus between Lake Michigan and Europe Lake. It is accessible via the Hotz and Europe Bay hiking trails.

Link to the description and map of Europe Bay Woods State Natural Area from the Wisconsin DNR.
www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: Europe Bay Woods
properties.Paragraph1_Text: Europe Bay Woods is located on an undeveloped isthmus between Lake Michigan and Europe Lake.  It is accessible via the Hotz and Europe Bay hiking trails.

properties.Name: Jackson Harbor Ridges
properties.description:
Jackson Harbor Ridges

Situated on Washington Island off the tip of the Door Peninsula, Jackson Harbor Ridges contains several coastal plant communities and a rich flora of rare and uncommon plants. It was designated a State Natural Area in 1973.

Link to the description and map of Jackson Harbor Ridges State Natural Area from the Wisconsin DNR.
www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: Jackson Harbor Ridges
properties.Paragraph1_Text: Situated on Washington Island off the tip of the Door Peninsula, Jackson Harbor Ridges contains several coastal plant communities and a rich flora of rare and uncommon plants. It was designated a State Natural Area in 1973.

properties.Name: Little Lake
properties.description:
Little Lake

The shallow, 24-acre Little Lake is the only inland lake located on Washington Island. Located within 250 feet of Lake Michigan, Little Lake's present water level rises about 3 feet above it. The area was once home to a large village of Native Americans and hosts a Native American burial ground.

Link to the description and map of Little Lake State Natural Area from the Wisconsin DNR.
www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: Little Lake
properties.Paragraph1_Text: The shallow, 24-acre Little Lake is the only inland lake located on Washington Island. Located within 250 feet of Lake Michigan, Little Lake's present water level rises about 3 feet above it. The area was once home to a large village of Native Americans and hosts a Native American burial ground.

properties.Name: Marshall's Point
properties.description:
Marshall's Point

Marshall's Point is located along the Door Peninsula and includes 2000 feet of Lake Michigan shoreline. Public access is restricted due to the sensitive nature of the site.

Link to the description of Marshall's Point State Natural Area from the Wisconsin DNR.
www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: Marshall's Point
properties.Paragraph1_Text: Marshall's Point is located along the Door Peninsula and includes 2000 feet of Lake Michigan shoreline. Public access is restricted due to the sensitive nature of the site.

properties.Name: Meridian Park
properties.description:
Meridian Park

Meridian Park is situated on an isthmus of sand between the south end of Kangaroo Lake and Lake Michigan. The site contains a diverse set of natural features including mile-long 50-to-60 feet high sand dunes.

Link to the description and map of Meridian Park State Natural Area from the Wisconsin DNR.
www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: Meridian Park
properties.Paragraph1_Text: Meridian Park is situated on an isthmus of sand between the south end of Kangaroo Lake and Lake Michigan. The site contains a diverse set of natural features including mile-long 50-to-60 feet high sand dunes.

properties.Name: Mink River Estuary
properties.description:
Mink River Estuary

The Mink River Estuary is one of the most pristine freshwater estuaries in the country. The natural area contains diverse vegetation and animal species. It was designated a State Natural Area in 1988.

Link to the description and map of Mink River Estuary State Natural Area from the Wisconsin DNR.
www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: Mink River Estuary
properties.Paragraph1_Text: The Mink River Estuary is one of the most pristine freshwater estuaries in the country. The natural area contains diverse vegetation and animal species.  It was designated a State Natural Area in 1988.

properties.Name: Moonlight Bay Bedrock Beach
properties.description:
Moonlight Bay Bedrock Beach

Moonlight Bay Bedrock Beach protects a 5-acre undisturbed bedrock beach, rare plant and animal communities, geological features, and adjacent forest. The 112-acre site was designated a SNA in 1990.

Link to the description and map of Moonlight Bay Bedrock Beach State Natural Area from the Wisconsin DNR.
www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: Moonlight Bay Bedrock Beach
properties.Paragraph1_Text: Moonlight Bay Bedrock Beach protects a 5-acre undisturbed bedrock beach, rare plant and animal communities, geological features, and adjacent forest.  The 112-acre site was designated a SNA in 1990.

properties.Name: Mud Lake
properties.description:
Mud Lake

Mud Lake State Natural Area consists of a 155-acre shallow (maximum depth 5 feet) lake surrounded by an extensive swamp. The site is a total of 1,190 acres that lies within the Mud Lake Wildlife Area.

Link to the description and map of Mud Lake State Natural Area from the Wisconsin DNR.
www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: Mud Lake
properties.Paragraph1_Text: Mud Lake State Natural Area consists of a 155-acre shallow (maximum depth 5 feet) lake surrounded by an extensive swamp.  The site is a total of 1,190 acres that lies within the Mud Lake Wildlife Area.

properties.Name: Newport Conifer-Hardwoods
properties.description:
Newport Conifer-Hardwoods

Newport Conifer Hardwoods features a mix of northern forest types along Lake Michigan near the northern tip of the Door Peninsula. About a quarter of a mile of frontage on Lake Michigan is included in the natural area, which was designated a State Natural Area in 1971.

Link to the description and map of Newport Conifer-Hardwoods State Natural Area from the Wisconsin DNR.
www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: Newport Conifer-Hardwoods
properties.Paragraph1_Text: Newport Conifer Hardwoods features a mix of northern forest types along Lake Michigan near the northern tip of the Door Peninsula. About a quarter of a mile of frontage on Lake Michigan is included in the natural area, which was  designated a State Natural Area in 1971.

properties.Name: North Bay
properties.description:
North Bay

North Bay features one of the last remaining undeveloped stretches of Lake Michigan shore on the Door Peninsula, with nearly one mile of uninterrupted lakeshore. It is an important habitat for numerous nesting birds, as well as game fish.

Link to the description and map of North Bay State Natural Area from the Wisconsin DNR.
www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: North Bay
properties.Paragraph1_Text: North Bay features one of the last remaining undeveloped stretches of Lake Michigan shore on the Door Peninsula, with nearly one mile of uninterrupted lakeshore. It is an important habitat for numerous nesting birds, as well as game fish.

properties.Name: Peninsula Park Beech Forest
properties.description:
Peninsula Park Beech Forest

Access to the Peninsula Park Beech Forest is via the Sentinel Hiking Trail, which forms the northern boundary of the site. This 80-acre site was designated a State Natural Area in 1952.

Link to the description and map of Peninsula Park Beech Forest State Natural Area from the Wisconsin DNR.
www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: Peninsula Park Beech Forest
properties.Paragraph1_Text: Access to the Peninsula Park Beech Forest is via the Sentinel Hiking Trail, which forms the northern boundary of the site.  This 80-acre site was  designated a State Natural Area in 1952.

properties.Name: Peninsula Park White Cedar Forest
properties.description:
Peninsula Park White Cedar Forest

Peninsula Park White Cedar Forest is located within Peninsula State Park. The site features a one-acre open marsh, an open meadow on a lake dune, and a white cedar swamp.

Link to the description and map of Peninsula Park White Cedar Forest State Natural Area from the Wisconsin DNR.
www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: Peninsula Park White Cedar Forest
properties.Paragraph1_Text: Peninsula Park White Cedar Forest  is located within Peninsula State Park. The site features a one-acre open marsh, an open meadow on a lake dune, and a white cedar swamp.

properties.Name: Rock Island Woods
properties.description:
Rock Island Woods

Rock Island Woods is a 570-acre site located within Rock Island State Park. It features many rare plants and animals and a variety of forest types. No motor vehicles are allowed on the site.

Link to the description and map of Rock Island Woods State Natural Area from the Wisconsin DNR.
www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: Rock Island Woods
properties.Paragraph1_Text: Rock Island Woods is a 570-acre site located within Rock Island State Park. It features many rare plants and animals and a variety of forest types. No motor vehicles are allowed on the site.

properties.Name: Sister Islands
properties.description:
Sister Islands

Sister Islands is an historic gull and tern nesting area consisting of two low, gravel islands. It is one of the important gulleries in Green Bay. It was designated a State Natural Area in 1966. Access by boat.

Link to the description of Sister Islands State Natural Area from the Wisconsin DNR.
www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: Sister Islands
properties.Paragraph1_Text: Sister Islands is an historic gull and tern nesting area consisting of two low, gravel islands. It is one of the important gulleries in Green Bay. It was designated a State Natural Area in 1966. Access by boat.

properties.Name: The Ridges Sanctuary
properties.description:
The Ridges Sanctuary

The Ridges Sanctuary encompasses a diversity of unusual habitats, resulting in one of the greatest concentrations of rare plants in the Midwest. It is recognized as a National Natural Landmark, and was designated a State Natural Area in 1953.

Link to the description and map of The Ridges Sanctuary State Natural Area from the Wisconsin DNR.
www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: The Ridges Sanctuary
properties.Paragraph1_Text: The Ridges Sanctuary encompasses a diversity of unusual habitats, resulting in one of the greatest concentrations of rare plants in the Midwest.  It is recognized as a National Natural Landmark, and was designated a State Natural Area in 1953.

properties.Name: Toft Point
properties.description:
Toft Point

Toft Point is situated on a 1-mile-wide peninsula along Door County's Lake Michigan coast. The natural area is bordered on the north by Moonlight Bay, and on the south by Baileys Harbor. The site is recognized as a National Natural Landmark and was designated a State Natural Area in 1967.

Link to the description and map of Toft Point State Natural Area from the Wisconsin DNR.
www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: Toft Point
properties.Paragraph1_Text: Toft Point is situated on a 1-mile-wide peninsula along Door County's Lake Michigan coast. The natural area is bordered on the north by Moonlight Bay, and on the south by Baileys Harbor. The site is recognized as a National Natural Landmark and was designated a State Natural Area in 1967.

properties.Name: White Cliff Fen and Forest
properties.description:
White Cliff Fen and Forest

White Cliff Fen and Forest features a deep, undisturbed forest. The area lies less than ½ mile from Green Bay. Access via trials or the nearby boat launch.

Link to the description and map of White Cliff Fen and Forest State Natural Area from the Wisconsin DNR.
www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: White Cliff Fen and Forest
properties.Paragraph1_Text: White Cliff Fen and Forest features a deep, undisturbed forest. The area lies less than ½ mile from Green Bay. Access via trials or the nearby boat launch.

properties.Name: Whitefish Dunes
properties.description:
Whitefish Dunes

Whitefish Dunes State Natural Area preserves the largest and most significant Great Lakes dunescape in Wisconsin. The site contains a rich flora particularly adapted to this dynamic habitat. It was designated a State Natural Area in 1980.

Link to the description and map of Whitefish Dunes State Natural Area from the Wisconsin DNR.
www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: Whitefish Dunes
properties.Paragraph1_Text: Whitefish Dunes State Natural Area preserves the largest and most significant Great Lakes dunescape in Wisconsin. The site contains a rich flora particularly adapted to this dynamic habitat. It was designated a State Natural Area in 1980.

properties.Name: Red Banks Alvar
properties.description:
Red Banks Alvar

Red Banks Alvar contains one of the most diverse land snail communities known in the Midwest and is one of the most important areas in Wisconsin for snails. The site is situated on flat bedrock with very shallow soils.

Link to the description and map of Red Banks Alvar State Natural Area from the Wisconsin DNR.
www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: Red Banks Alvar
properties.Paragraph1_Text: Red Banks Alvar contains one of the most diverse land snail communities known in the Midwest and is one of the most important areas in Wisconsin for snails. The site is situated on flat bedrock with very shallow soils.

properties.Name: Wilderness Ridge
properties.description:
Wilderness Ridge

Wilderness Ridge is a T-shaped area that features a cross section of Glacial Lake Nippissing-aged beach ridges. This 8-acre site was designated a State Natural Area in 1953.

Link to the description and map of Wilderness Ridge State Natural Area from the Wisconsin DNR.
www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: Wilderness Ridge
properties.Paragraph1_Text: Wilderness Ridge is a T-shaped area that features a cross section of Glacial Lake Nippissing-aged beach ridges. This 8-acre site was designated a State Natural Area in 1953.

properties.Name: Two Creeks Buried Forest
properties.description:
Two Creeks Buried Forest

Two Creeks Buried Forest is a unit of the Ice Age National Scientific Reserve and has been a popular study site for North American geologists, botanists, glacial ecologists and climatologists. It was designated a State Natural Area in 1967.

Link to the description and map of Two Creeks Buried Forest State Natural Area from the Wisconsin DNR.
www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: Two Creeks Buried Forest
properties.Paragraph1_Text: Two Creeks Buried Forest is a unit of the Ice Age National Scientific Reserve and has been a popular study site for North American geologists, botanists, glacial ecologists and climatologists. It was designated a State Natural Area in 1967.

properties.Name: Point Beach Ridges
properties.description:
Point Beach Ridges

Point Beach Ridges features 11 alternating ridges and swales that are parallel to the present Lake Michigan shoreline. The endangered sand dune willow is found here at its only known Wisconsin location.

Link to the description and map of Point Beach Ridges State Natural Area from the Wisconsin DNR.
www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: Point Beach Ridges
properties.Paragraph1_Text: Point Beach Ridges features 11 alternating ridges and swales that are parallel to the present Lake Michigan shoreline. The endangered sand dune willow is found here at its only known Wisconsin location.

properties.Name: Woodland Dunes
properties.description:
Woodland Dunes

Woodland Dunes features a series of narrow, parallel sand ridges. The site, with its variety of habitats and proximity to Lake Michigan, is used by a great diversity of birds. Trails run through the site.

Link to the description and map of Woodland Dunes State Natural Area from the Wisconsin DNR.
www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: Woodland Dunes
properties.Paragraph1_Text: Woodland Dunes features a series of narrow, parallel sand ridges.  The site, with its variety of habitats and proximity to Lake Michigan, is used by a great diversity of birds. Trails run through the site.

properties.Name: LTC Old-Growth Forest
properties.description:
LTC Old-Growth Forest

LTC Old Growth Forest protects a small remnant of old-growth northern mesic forest on the Cleveland campus of Lakeshore Technical College. Centerville Creek flows through the property from west to east and divides the property in two pieces. The northern half of the site is dominated by sugar maple and American beech. The southern part of the site is situated in the floodplain of Centerville Creek and contains several prominent oxbows and ephemeral vernal pools. LTC Old-Growth Forest is owned by the Lakeshore Technical College and was designated a State Natural Area in 2011.

Link to the description and map of LTC Old-Growth Forest State Natural Area from the Wisconsin DNR.
www.wisconsincoastalguide.org

The southern part of the site is situated in the floodplain of Centerville Creek and contains several prominent oxbows and ephemeral vernal pools. properties.Name: Cedar Grove Hawk Research Station
properties.description:
Cedar Grove Hawk Research Station

Cedar Grove Hawk Research Station is located on a 1,000-foot-wide beach of former glacial Lake Algonquin. It has been used as a trapping and banding station for more than 50 years. It was designated a State Natural Area in 1952.

Link to the description of Cedar Grove Hawk Research Station State Natural Area from the Wisconsin DNR.
www.wisconsincoastalguide.org

properties.Name: Kohler Park Dunes
properties.description:
Kohler Park Dunes

Embracing the shore of Lake Michigan, Kohler Park Dunes contains lake dunes, wetlands, and a small white pine forest. More than one mile of Lake Michigan beach is included in the natural area, which was designated in 1969.

Link to the description and map of Kohler Park Dunes State Natural Area from the Wisconsin DNR.
www.wisconsincoastalguide.org

properties.Name: Fairy Chasm
properties.description:
Fairy Chasm

Fairy Chasm features an 80-100 foot deep chasm that is cut by Fish Creek, a small, fast-flowing, stream. The site was designated in 1968. Access is by permission only.

Link to the description of Fairy Chasm State Natural Area from the Wisconsin DNR.
www.wisconsincoastalguide.org

properties.Paragraph1_Text: Fairy Chasm features an 80-100 foot deep chasm that is cut by Fish Creek, a small, fast-flowing, stream. The site was designated in 1968. Access is by permission only.

properties.Name: Warnimont Bluff Fens
properties.description:
Warnimont Bluff Fens

Warnimont Bluff Fens features wetlands situated on 100 foot high clay banks along the Lake Michigan shore. It is an important site for research and education. It was designated a State Natural Area in 2002.

Link to the description of Warnimont Bluff Fens State Natural Area from the Wisconsin DNR.
www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: Warnimont Bluff Fens

properties.Name: Chiwaukee Prairie
properties.description:
Chiwaukee Prairie

The natural area consists of two parts, separated by 116th Street. The southern portion is a large, contiguous prairie area; the northern part consists of prairie fragmented by roads and scattered homes. It is one of the largest prairie complexes in the state and the most intact coastal wetland in southeastern Wisconsin.

Link to the description and map of Chiwaukee Prairie State Natural Area from the Wisconsin DNR.
www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
